Trial_Design.evidence: Patients undergoing cardiac surgery with CPB were randomized

Participants.evidence: Patients undergoing cardiac surgery with CPB

Intervention.evidence: randomized to receive either two preoperative subcutaneous injections of liraglutide or a matching placebo

Objective.evidence: We hypothesized that liraglutide increases pancreatic insulin secretion during cardiac surgery with cardiopulmonary bypass (CPB).

Method_Outcome.evidence: We measured hormone concentrations before and after surgery

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Patients undergoing cardiac surgery with CPB were randomized

Number_Randomised.evidence: Metabolic hormone concentrations were measured in 37 participants.

Result_Outcome.evidence: HOMA-B revealed that liraglutide increased insulin secretion relative to glycemia (258 ± 179 vs 116 ± 180, difference (95% CI): 142 (24–261), P = 0.004).
